Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label different types of land habitats (e.g., playground, garden, forest, parking lot) and water habitats (e.g., pond, stream, lake).
The student can draw and label various kinds of living things (e.g., trees, grasses, bushes, flowering plants, lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, clams) that are found in each habitat.
The student can illustrate and label patterns and differences in plant and animal diversity between the two habitats.
The student can organize their drawings to compare the variety of living things in each habitat, showing how some plants and animals are specific to certain environments.
The student can provide a description next to the drawing explaining how the observations support their understanding of biodiversity in different habitats.
